content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #91128 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?
being the new LLVM pass manager still behind an unstable flag, would it be ok a P-high here (instead of p-critical)?
Isn't the pass manager on by default? It's the opposite, you need an unstable flag to turn it off
uhm ... you're right. I had checked #74705 but then overlooked PR #88243 that enabled the default for it
in this case I'd re-evaluate for a p-critical
though if I am correct next week the current beta will be promoted to stable. I don't have the context to figure out what can be done before then. a fix? disable it? plan a point release?
I am not sure what could be done though. The new pass manager brings perf improvement for some while regresses others.
Also the new pass manager would eventually replace the old one, so I think it'll be better to figure out what exactly went wrong (but this issue doesn't give any code to reproduce)

for my reference, also this comment about the timeline for releases
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/238009-t-compiler.2Fmeetings/topic/.5Bplanning.20meeting.5D.202021-11-19/near/262079139
I wonder if this is another case of #89524.
Probably the inliner patch by nikic should be backported before release?
Oh this issue does mention that inliner patch doesn't help. My bad.
I think the priority should be independent of the release date. We should flag this as critical either way so the release team is aware.
ok I think then we agree about p-critical, then :thumbs_up:
